bow: what do you do when friend complains about your child my two year old son is screecher but honestly don mind if he squeals when he is having fun he two and he excited just attribute it to normal just having fun and playing with her children it puts some tension in the air when we hang out like ve said personally don mind when my kid makes some noise when he is enjoying himself and he is two not ten we all know how challenging it can be to reason with young toddler and pick my battles but find my friend comments offsetting and think she needs to lighten up bit just don think it right to criticize another person child thoughts yup she needs to chill out if it good friend laugh and make joke about just hope she grows out of it my close friends and nicely pick on our kids all the time but if it was said rudely or condescending would simply say when you insult my son it also insults me my brother in law can not handle loud noises and just grimaces and complains whenever my kids are laughing and having fun if the sound of kids laughing and having fun bothers you wear freaking earplugs like you in that do mind my son also two making loud noises when he is happy now that you know she does like it perhaps you can just try to limit loud screeching when you guys are over at her house and then if she comments on it when you are at your house you can say something like in this house screeching from happiness is okay so glad to see that others are on the same page as long as my child is having fun and not hurting himself or others don care about which sounds he makes okay my niece is this way our daughters are mos apart and ll be honest it drives me absolutely crazy don say anything to my sister but know that many people have when my niece is at my house always tell her when we re inside she can use her inside voice she listens but she also my kiddo is and he does happy screeches as well when people mostly family complain about it just say it how he expresses that he is happy you do want him to be happy and then they kinda shut up after have little yo who has the highest pitch scream when you tell him no occasionally it comes out when he gets excited too can take it when tell him no and he does jt tell him screaming like that is not ok when he excited will say know you re excited but let try to be little quieter don think he understands yet but he will soon so keep at it am big on manners and realizing your surroundings so feel like need to teach my kids loud screams are not always ok but we all parent differently and people tell me let kids be kids and respond that agree and let my kids be good kids is it right or wrong who knows but it what my gut guides me to do catch flack if my kid screams and catch flack if correct him when people comment on it don take it personally because it is annoying and understand that normally shrug my shoulders and say yeah it annoying he and all yo can do annoying things then under my breath say you are annoying too lol should they comment who knows ll never understand why people always have to state the obvious and share their opinions would never say anything to someone kid who does something that drives me nuts you either tolerate it or don hang out but telling you how to raise your kid and provide correction is not ok with me my husband is very sensitive to certain noises they can trigger migraines and they create nails on chalkboard effect on him he wears ear plugs with noise cancelling headphones on top when our son is in shrieking phase so sympathize with your friend that said there not much you can do about it at that age maybe just express sympathy but remain firm that it behavior you re not aiming to correct ll probably get massively downvoted but got ta play devil advocate here in the same camp as your friend those loud high pitch screams grate on my nerves amp put me right on edge it can trigger anxiety in some people if it big problem for her maybe try to organise time to catch up without your son maybe girls night out it might result in you not seeing her very often as the parent you re likely to have much higher tolerance for these things than the average person amp if it something she ca cope with well that needs to be as ok as him being noisy they re just incompatible at this stage my son also screeches when he having fun he months old if one of my friends complained just say hey you re grown up you re free to leave anytime you want brush it off she your friend and she just letting you know how she feels at least she being honest about it with you screeching from anyone is annoying ll be honest screeching drive me up the wall it triggers migraines and there just something about it that makes me uneasy would never say anything about it if was close to the kids mom though now with my close friends will openly acknowledge that it annoying just like they will acknowledge that certain things that my kid does annoys me it does bug me when close friends say stuff because know the love my child dearly just like love their children ll also probably be massively downvoted but have ocd and certain sounds trigger anxiety and headaches for me this is one of them and handle both my husband and are on top of reminding my daughter not to screech regularly because it just drives us crazy think scheduling nights out with your friend like the person above suggested is having great time your friend needs new perspective glad to hear this as due in august have chronic migraines and permanent sound sensitivity and my husband had pretty intense add as child and was loud and rambunctious from birth so have ear plugs and noise canceling headphones on my buy list figure if can lessen the irritation by even 10 it ll help recommend the howard leight earplugs they re at balloon because it my problem that sensitive to it not hers and certainly not the kids fault if it makes you uncomfortable to hang out with this friend because she does like something about your because she feels terrible but refuses to sleep yes it normal but also at you can start to teach societal expectations in an age appropriate and positive manner one of mine was loud to the point it drove us nuts started saying ouch too loud to him in calm voice not yelling mean and taught him it took while to be kind to other people and their ears so imho view yes you should start teaching voice modulation now and your friend needs to understand that this is normal phase and he will be screeching for while to come not fan of any loud noises tbh get sensory overload just from going outside on change my parenting style for someone else and do think you should have to do so either for something so minor give her the choice to let it go or only see you without the kids the ball is in her screeching friend and if he is in my house he follows my rules no screeching but at his house don make any comment yeah no screeching or screaming allowed with us either just gently say to my own kids have right to stop seeing you so frequently because it bothers them it goes both ways everything has consequences only commenting because have seen this point of view in the comments we taught our son not to screech scream constantly because the first few times he did it out of our line of sight we thought something was wrong or he got hurt after couple good scares we taught him not to so that we would know if he needed us to come running if he was just screeching for whatever reason all the time was worried we might inadvertently tune it out and not notice when he really needed us to notice also it was very important to us to teach our son to behave appropriately in public and that starts at home from very early age removed your child is the perfect age to start teaching inside voice when he does his loud screeching say ouch that hurts my ears that is an outside voice we use an inside voice inside when he does it again tell him he can go outside if he wants to be loud when he does it again put on his shoes and coat and put him outside it dont take him long to learn especially if you are consistent but he is hurting others with his loud voice how did you teach him not to screech
